text: Who's There
There once was a tiny caterpillar who saw a nice cave.
"I just want place to take a nap," said caterpillar.
He crawled inside and fell asleep.
But the cave belonged to Jackal.
Jackal came home and saw Caterpillar sleeping on her bed.
"Hey, that's my bed!
Get out!"
growled Jackal, and she swatted him out with her tail.
Caterpillar was angry.
"I'll show her," he said.
Caterpillar waited for Jackal to leave.
Then he made strange footprints near the cave.
When Jackal came back home, she saw the footprints and barked, "Who's there?"
Caterpillar yelled from deep inside the cave, and his voice made a scary echo.
"I'm a monster! ... monster! ... monster!
Stronger than a lion! ... lion! ... lion!"
Jackal jumped.
She was too scared to run away, so she folded her big ears over her eyes.
After a little while, Jackal's friend Leopard came over to borrow a cup of milk.
When Leopard saw her, she cried, "Jackal! What's wrong?"
Jackal uncovered one eye and said, "There's a monster in my cave!"
"A monster?" asked Leopard.
"A monster stronger than a lion!" cried Jackal.
Leopard went to the cave door.
"Grr," she growled, and put out her claws.
"Who's there?"
Caterpillar yelled, "I'm a monster! ... monster! ... monster!
Meaner than a snake! ... snake! ... snake!"
Leopard was very scared of snakes.
"M...m...meaner than a snake?" she whispered, and she shook so hard that her spots began to fall off.
Just then, giant Rhino the Rhinoceros walked by.
When he saw Jackal and Leopard, he said, "What's wrong?
What are you scared of?"
"There's a monster in my cave!" cried Jackal.
"A monster?" asked Rhino.
"A monster meaner than a snake!" whispered Leopard.
Rhino went to the door and roared, "WHO'S THERE?"
Caterpillar yelled, "I'm a monster! ... monster! ... monster!
Bigger than a rhinoceros! ... rhinoceros! ... rhinoceros!"
"Bigger than me?" said Rhino.
"It can't be."
Rhino was so scared that he tried to hide under a branch.
However, he didn't fool anyone.
He was far too big to hide.
Just then, a tree frog on Rhino's branch said, "Hey! What's wrong?
What are you hiding from?"
"A monster bigger than me!" said Rhino.
"And meaner than a snake!" said Leopard.
"And stronger than a lion!" said Jackal.
Frog said, "We'll see about that."
Frog hopped up to the cave door.
She filled up her throat and yelled, "I am the scariest monster!
RIBBIT ... RIBBIT ... RIBBIT ... RIBBIT!"
Caterpillar's legs began to shake.
"Oh, no!" he cried.
"I've got to get out of here!"
Jackal jumped up on Leopard's back to hide, and Leopard jumped up on Rhino's back.
Then Caterpillar came crawling out.
"It was you?" they yelled.
Caterpillar smiled. "Sorry! I just wanted a place to take a nap!"
Then all the animals laughed and laughed.
And after that, Jackal let Caterpillar live in the cave with her.
